import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import os
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
data=pd.read_csv("../input/zomato.csv")
source.668cbc9e: print('We have nearly data of',data.shape[0],'food orders.' )
source.788cddb8: print('SO This chart tells that most prefered hotel types are:' ,data['rest_type'].value_counts().head(8).index.values)
source.f2674778:
data=data[data['dish_liked'].notnull()]
data.index=range(data.shape[0])
import re
likes=[]
for i in range(data.shape[0]):
    splited_array=re.split(',',data['dish_liked'][i])
    for item in splited_array:
        likes.append(item)

sns.barplot(pd.DataFrame(likes)[0].value_counts().head(10),pd.DataFrame(likes)[0].value_counts().head(10).index,orient='h')
source.daa53b77: print("The above chart tells us that the Bangalorean people mostly prefer This foods:",pd.DataFrame(likes)[0].value_counts().head(10).index.values)
source.e576bde8: print("The above chart tells us that the Bangalorean people hardly prefer these foods:",pd.DataFrame(likes)[0].value_counts().tail(10).index.values)
source.4d6a10df:
rating_data=data[np.logical_and(data['rate'].notnull(), data['rate']!='NEW')]
rating_data.index=range(rating_data.shape[0])
import re
rating=[]
for i in range(rating_data.shape[0]):
    rating.append(rating_data['rate'][i][:3])

rating_data['rate']=rating
rating_data.sort_values('rate',ascending=False)[['name','location','rate']].head(60).drop_duplicates()
source.47bbab3c: print('This are the highest rated hotels in banglore:\n',rating_data.sort_values('rate',ascending=False)[['name']].head(60).drop_duplicates().values)
source.930b9e3c: print('This are the highest rated hotels in banglore:\n',rating_data.sort_values('rate',ascending=True)[['name','location','rate']].head(50).drop_duplicates().values)
